content:
• Friday, June 17, 2011
  • BRK.A

    Shares of Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A +0.2%) have been sliding, and Stifel...

    Shares of Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A +0.2%) have been sliding, and Stifel Nicolaus says there's still more room on the downside. "Berkshire’s tripartite exposure to economic weakness (its own operating units, equity holdings, and derivatives) justifies its recent underperformance,” Stifel says.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 3 Comments
  • SNI

    Scripps Networks Interactive (SNI +5.7%) leads all S&P gainers after its largest...

    Scripps Networks Interactive (SNI +5.7%) leads all S&P gainers after its largest shareholder, the Edward W. Scripps Trust, files a petition to prepare for the trust's administration following its termination upon the death of Scripps’ last living grandchild, who is now 93 years old.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • GNMK

    GenMark Diagnostics (GNMK +42%) soars on heavy volume after pricing its 7.07M share secondary...

    GenMark Diagnostics (GNMK +42%) soars on heavy volume after pricing its 7.07M share secondary offering at $4.25, slightly below Thursday's close. The deal was heavily over-subscribed and removes an overhang that has been pressuring the stock for the past week.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • FCF

    Keefe, Bruyette raises First Commonwealth (FCF +3.5%) to outperform on price weakness, saying...

    Keefe, Bruyette raises First Commonwealth (FCF +3.5%) to outperform on price weakness, saying the bank will likely continue to deal with additional credit costs in the near term, but its capital reserve is strong enough to handle any credit problems.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum Communications (SPRD +4.4%) is taking advantage of recent price weakness to...

    Spreadtrum Communications (SPRD +4.4%) is taking advantage of recent price weakness to repurchase up to $100M ADS's. The company says it's flush with cash, and the buyback "reflects our confidence with our near- and long-term growth initiatives."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • GOOG

    Google (GOOG -2.1%) shares slump to a nine-month low after Raymond James' checks with search...

    Google (GOOG -2.1%) shares slump to a nine-month low after Raymond James' checks with search engine marketers show less-than-expected paid-search spending. "U.S. retail paid-search spend is up high-single low-double digits Y/Y but below... expectations of 15-20%." Shares haven’t closed below $500 since September; they're now at ~$490.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • MCO

    Columbia University's John Coffee tells TheStreet.com that the SEC may actually be building a...

    Columbia University's John Coffee tells TheStreet.com that the SEC may actually be building a strong civil fraud case against Moody's (MCO -6.6%) and S&P (MHP -4.6%) for their roles in the financial crisis, saying “evidence compiled by several economic researchers shows strong evidence the ratings firms systematically engaged in grade inflation." (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 3 Comments
  • REGN

    Nasdaq says Regeneron (NASDAQ:REGN) will resume trading from an all-day halt at 2:20 p.m. after...

    Nasdaq says Regeneron (NASDAQ:REGN) will resume trading from an all-day halt at 2:20 p.m. after its eye drug's unanimous OK from an FDA panel. Updated 2:20 p.m.: REGN resumes up 3.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion's (RIMM -20.9%) sixth-largest shareholder, Jarislowsky Fraser Ltd., cuts its...

    Research In Motion's (RIMM -20.9%) sixth-largest shareholder, Jarislowsky Fraser Ltd., cuts its stake in half and is “on the way out” of the stock, Bloomberg reports; the CEO thinks RIMM executives are “resting on their laurels.” Tiernan Ray of Barron's sees this kind of defection as increasing the pressure for a shakeup at the top.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • BH-OLD

    Biglari Holdings (NYSE:BH-OLD) - the Berkshire-ish company that counts Steak n Shake and Western...

    Biglari Holdings (NYSE:BH-OLD) - the Berkshire-ish company that counts Steak n Shake and Western Sizzlin in its portfolio - rises 4.1% after its SEC filing showing CEO and chairman Sardar Biglari buying $56,565 worth of shares. CL King's Michael Gallo explains: The purchase at $377.13 is the chairman's first since shares were $300.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • JKS

    The spot price of polysilicon (chief raw ingredient for solar panels) has dropped more than 33%...

    The spot price of polysilicon (chief raw ingredient for solar panels) has dropped more than 33% this quarter to a six-year low, as firms get rid of stockpiles at cost or below amid slashed subsidies in Europe. The drop may benefit Chinese firms like JinkoSolar (JKS -4%) and Trina Solar (TSL +1%), but Arizona's First Solar (FSLR +3.2%) uses a different raw material and may feel margin pressure.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • PRMW

    Primo Water (NASDAQ:PRMW) - a provider of purified bottled water and dispensers - leaps 16.5% as...

    Primo Water (NASDAQ:PRMW) - a provider of purified bottled water and dispensers - leaps 16.5% as it prices a 6M-share offering at Thursday's closing price of $11.26. Some 2.6M shares are coming from existing shareholders including Culligan International.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 3 Comments
  • BR

    JP Morgan upgrades Broadridge Financial (BR +2.5%) to overweight and raises its price target to...

    JP Morgan upgrades Broadridge Financial (BR +2.5%) to overweight and raises its price target to $28. The firm says new deals recently inked by its technology services division could bring a $0.60-$0.70 boost in earnings over the next two years.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -20%) shares plunge to trade at their lowest since 2006. One of at...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -20%) shares plunge to trade at their lowest since 2006. One of at least six downgrades so far today, Citigroup cites 10 ways things can get even worse - among them: “We’ve seen this movie before (Motorola, Nokia, Sony-Ericsson, LG, Palm)... history of wireless is littered with OEMs that had significant product/cycle share gains, but then missed structural market shifts.”

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 5 Comments
  • HRBN

    Harbin Electric (NASDAQ:HRBN) +13% after responding to yesterday's Citron critique, saying the...

    Harbin Electric (NASDAQ:HRBN) +13% after responding to yesterday's Citron critique, saying the CEO's brother (who may have been implicated in a fraudulent loan guarantee) is not part of HRBN's board. Harbin stands behind its SEC filings, and affirms CDB's ongoing support of the proposed $400M CEO buyout of the company. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM | 3 Comments
  • MIND

    Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND) announces a public offering to sell an unspecified number of...

    Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND) announces a public offering to sell an unspecified number of shares to repay its revolving credit facility and purchase equipment for expansion of its Canadian and Russian operations. Shares -9% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • DS

    Newcastle Investment (NCT) jumps 20% after reinstating its quarterly dividend at $0.10. NCT says...

    Newcastle Investment (NCT) jumps 20% after reinstating its quarterly dividend at $0.10. NCT says it expects to close $144M in new investments in the next 30 days. (PR) Shares have shed almost half their value since weak earnings in March.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • CBLI

    Cleveland BioLabs (NASDAQ:CBLI) says it will sell almost 9M shares to raise $23.5M. For $4,...

    Cleveland BioLabs (NASDAQ:CBLI) says it will sell almost 9M shares to raise $23.5M. For $4, buyers get one common share, and warrants to buy half a share at $4.50 and $5.00 for the next 1-5 years. CBLI -14% premarket to $3.81. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • ZRAN

    British chipmaker CSR will acquire Zoran (ZRAN +21%), a technology developer for digital...

    British chipmaker CSR will acquire Zoran (ZRAN +21%), a technology developer for digital photography and video, for a reduced price of $484M ($6.26/share in cash and 0.589 CSR shares) following a deterioration in ZRAN's performance. The original $679M price-tag was before the Japan earthquake, and before Cisco Systems (NASDAQ:CSCO) canned the Flip.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • LPS

    Lender Processing Services (NYSE:LPS) -11.2% premarket after sharply lowering Q2 guidance,...

    Lender Processing Services (NYSE:LPS) -11.2% premarket after sharply lowering Q2 guidance, saying lower default volumes and sluggish activity in the refinancing marketplace have hurt its bottom line. Keefe Bruyette downgrades the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZRAN

    Premarket gainers: ZRAN +21%. NCT +18%. HRBN +16%. SPRD +9%. NBG +8%. DANG +6%. YOKU +6%. BBVA...

    Premarket gainers: ZRAN +21%. NCT +18%. HRBN +16%. SPRD +9%. NBG +8%. DANG +6%. YOKU +6%. BBVA +5%. PRMW +6%. CTIC +5%. STD +5%. RENN +4%. TEF +4%. NOK +4%. ING +3%. BJ-OLD +3%. DB +3%. ALU +3%. DRYS +3%. BIDU +3%. SNY +3%.
    Losers: RIMM -16%. CBLI -15%. MIND -9%. LPL -6%. CHU -4%. WACLY -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • VVUS

    Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) reports positive results for phase III testing of its erectile dysfunction...

    Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) reports positive results for phase III testing of its erectile dysfunction drug Avanafil. The study is the last in a series to evaluate the drug's safety and efficacy in treating ED in patients who have undergone a radical prostatectomy. Shares +4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM
  • NBGGY

    "Recycling the same faces . to follow the same failed policies," is how a spokesman for Greece's...

    "Recycling the same faces ... to follow the same failed policies," is how a spokesman for Greece's opposition New Democracy party describes Papandreou's cabinet reshuffle. Nevertheless, shares like the news. Athens +4.8%. Stoxx 50 +1.6%, NBG +7.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM | 2 Comments
  • BB

    Sell-side firms pound Research In Motion (RIMM -16%) following yesterday's fiasco. JPMorgan says...

    Sell-side firms pound Research In Motion (RIMM -16%) following yesterday's fiasco. JPMorgan says reduced Q2 guidance and Bold 9900 delays are the two final nails in the coffin of its abandoned bullish stance. And Citi slams RIMM and supplier Celestica (CLS -4.4%) with a Sell rating, and warns things can still get worse.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • BJ-OLD

    P-E firm Leonard Green teams up with CVC Capital to make an offer of undisclosed size for BJ's...

    P-E firm Leonard Green teams up with CVC Capital to make an offer of undisclosed size for BJ's Wholesale (NYSE:BJ-OLD). As of yesterday, Leonard Green and its affiliates had a 9.3% stake in the third-largest U.S. wholesale club retailer. Shares +4.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 AM
